Package com.advertisementproject.campaignservice.messagebroker.config

Class MessageBrokerConfig

java.lang.Object
com.advertisementproject.campaignservice.messagebroker.config.MessageBrokerConfig
@Configuration
public class MessageBrokerConfig
extends java.lang.Object
Configurations for RabbitMQ message broker including specifications for queues and exchanges to be used for cross microservice communication

  • Constructor Details

    • MessageBrokerConfig

      public MessageBrokerConfig()

  • Method Details

    • deleteQueue

      @Bean public org.springframework.amqp.core.Queue deleteQueue()
      Queue configuration bean
      Returns:
      queue for receiving messages with a company id to know when a company's campaigns should be deleted

    • userDeleteExchange

      @Bean public org.springframework.amqp.core.FanoutExchange userDeleteExchange()
      Fanout exchange configuration bean
      Returns:
      fanout exchange for messages informing that a user's information should be deleted, which can be received by multiple applications that connect to the exchange with a queue. User id is identical to company id

    • userDeleteBinding

      @Bean public org.springframework.amqp.core.Binding userDeleteBinding()
      Queue to fanout exchange binding configuration bean
      Returns:
      binding between campaignsUserDeleteQueue and userDeleteExchange, which means that when a message is sent to "user.delete", a copy of that message will be sent to "campaignsUserDelete", which the application can listen for

    • companyQueue

      @Bean public org.springframework.amqp.core.Queue companyQueue()
      Queue configuration bean
      Returns:
      queue for receiving messages with a company object to update in the company database

    • companyExchange

      @Bean public org.springframework.amqp.core.FanoutExchange companyExchange()
      Fanout exchange configuration bean
      Returns:
      fanout exchange for messages including a company object, which can be received by multiple applications that connect to the exchange with a queue.

    • userAddBinding

      @Bean public org.springframework.amqp.core.Binding userAddBinding()
      Queue to fanout exchange binding configuration bean
      Returns:
      binding between companyQueue and companyExchange, which means that when a message is sent to "company", a copy of that message will be sent to "campaignsCompany", which the application can listen for
